DOC.brief_summary: This prospective , randomize , multi-center , international trial compare two reperfusion strategy elderly ( age > = 70 year ) patient acute myocardial infarction : primary percutaneous coronary intervention ( PCI ) versus intravenous thrombolytic therapy . Clinical endpoint collect hospital , 1 month , 6 month , 1 year post-randomization . The primary endpoint 30 day death disable stroke . The study null hypothesis significant difference death disable stroke 30 day post-randomization patient treat PCI versus thrombolytic .
DOC.brief_title: Senior PAMI : Primary Angioplasty Versus Thrombolytic Therapy Acute Myocardial Infarction Elderly
DOC.criteria: Age > = 70 Clinical symptom > 30 minute Symptom onset < = 12 hour ST segment elevation > = 1 mm 2 lead Prior thrombolytic Cardiogenic shock Cerebrovascular accident ( CVA ) Prolonged cardiopulmonary resuscitation ( CPR ) Blood pressure ( BP ) > 180/100 mm Hg Active bleed International Normalized Ratio ( INR ) > 1.4 Acetylsalicylic acid [ aspirin ] ( ASA ) heparin allergy History neutropenia , thrombocytopenia , hepatic dysfunction , renal insufficiency Peripheral vascular disease ( PVD )
